listing.description: A beautifully presented and unique 4 bedroom detached family home with high ceilings and fine features, set in stunning gardens in excess of an acre, with the option to purchase an additional 15 acres under separate negotiation. The property offers versatile living accommodation comprising 4 reception rooms, refurbished kitchen/breakfast room and conservatory with views over the gardens. A master bedroom with en-suite shower room and a further 3 double bedrooms and family bathroom. The extensive private rear gardens enjoy a lovely covered terrace with patio area, offering beautiful views over rolling countryside. EPC Rating EThe SettingThe Gunyah is located just on the outskirts of the Village of Stansted, occupying a private plot in excess of an acre, with mature gardens to the rear and driveway parking for numerous vehicles to the front of the property. The property is within walking distance to all the villages amenities, which include a range of shops, restaurants/bistros and public houses and schools for all ages. It is also within walking distance to the mainline railway station which gives access to London Liverpool Street and Cambridge. For road users, Junction 8 of the M11 is approximately 5 miles away, also giving access to London, Cambridge and the North. Stansted s International Airport is approximately 7 miles away.The AccommodationA covered porch way leads to a part-glazed wooden front door, opening onto a grand wooden panelled hallway, with tiled flooring and turned staircase rising to the first floor. Doors lead off to the main reception room, with a dual aspect, high ceilings and redbrick fire place with wood burning stove. French doors lead out to the covered terrace/entertaining area and rear garden. Further doors from the hallway lead off to a shower room, TV/family room, with redbrick fire place with wood burning stove and windows to the front and side of the property. There is a further reception room offering spacious office/study space, a guest bedroom and dining room with access through to the conservatory. The kitchen/breakfast room is well-appointed with tiled flooring, a good range of wall, base and storage units with granite work surfaces and Aga; and an external stable door leads out to a further patio/entertaining area. From the dining room, access to the conservatory gives a beautiful outlook over the extensive rear gardens, with 2 sets of French doors leading to the covered terrace and garden.Stairs rise to the first floor onto a generous galleried landing with an abundance of storage cupboards, and excellent utility space housing washing machine, tumble dryer and water softener which is adjacent to a large airing cupboard. Doors lead from the galleried landing on one side to the master bedroom, with built in wardrobe and en-suite shower room. A further 2 double bedrooms and family bathroom complete this floor.OutsideA gravel driveway leads to the property with a detached double garage with electric door. There is side access to the rear garden which is split in two, the top garden having an attractive pond area with the remainder being predominantly laid to lawn with mature trees and shrubs extending onto a productive orchard in the lower garden which boasts a selection fruit and walnut trees all in excess of an acre plot. There is also a large outbuilding and greenhouse. A special feature to the rear of the property is the covered terrace/entertaining area directly outside the main reception room and a further attractive patio accessed from the kitchen offers additional entertaining /bbq area, attached to the garage is a further outbuilding which could be used as an office/utility/wine store.ServicesPrivate drainage, oil fired central heating, water and electricity are connected.Local AuthorityUttlesford District CouncilImportant note to purchasers:We endeavour to make our sales particulars accurate and reliable, however, they do not constitute or form part of an offer or any contract and none is to be relied upon as statements of representation or fact. Any services, systems and appliances listed in this specification have not been tested by us and no guarantee as to their operating ability or efficiency is given. All measurements have been taken as a guide to prospective buyers only, and are not precise. Please be advised that some of the particulars may be awaiting vendor approval. If you require clarification or further information on any points, please contact us, especially if you are traveling some distance to view. Fixtures and fittings other than those mentioned are to be agreed with the seller./4

listing.description: This superb property originally built in 1970 has been imaginatively and sympathetically designed to blend with the hillside and local topography, as well as provide stunning views across the English Channel. On a clear day you can see France, watch the ferries going back and forth and in the evening you can even enjoy the twinkling lights of Calais. This lovely family home is in a very quiet and peaceful area as it is situated along a recently resurfaced private road that leads to the Dover Patrol Memorial and acres of National Trust land where you can walk for miles across breathtaking countryside. It is surrounded by a delightful garden and terraces with a large driveway providing plenty of off road and leading to the double garage and steps up to the front door.Off the large, light and bright entrance hall are stairs down to the garage, a cloakroom and a large and useful study. Here you can work undisturbed because the main living area is on the next level up a short flight of stairs. This includes an elegant L shaped sitting room with a veritable wall of windows and bi folding doors to the front terrace while the gorgeous L shaped kitchen/dining room with its muted coloured units, double oven, hob and integrated fridge and freezer will delight anyone who enjoys catering and entertaining. You can wander out to the large rear terrace from here through the patio doors and enjoy the secluded garden that backs onto woodland.Visitors can enjoy the privacy available in the charming guest suite on the next half landing. Here there is also the main bathroom with both a bath and a shower, while the three family double bedrooms and the stunning master suite are on the next floor. Above the guest bedroom is an amazing roof terrace providing excellent sea views where you can congregate for breakfast on a sunny morning. It is accessed via patio doors under a cathedral style window while at the top of the house is a galleried landing and a family room/snug that could also be used as another bedroom if required as it leads to a loft/storage room that could easily be converted to an en-suite bathroom. However, it is an ideal area older children looking for their own space.What the Owner says:We bought this house about three and a half years ago as we love the stunning sea views, looking out at the cliffs of Calais and the spectacular sunrises and sunsets. Natural light floods into the house and at night the moonlight reflecting on the sea can be enchanting. The ever-changing views that include passing ships, boats and yachts provide ongoing interest. However, we have now decided to move so we can be closer to our children and the growing number of grandchildren.We love the friendly village with its restaurants, hotel and pubs as well as a post office, village shop and a library. There are great walks from immediately outside our front door including along the clifftops or down to the charming beach. Alternatively take a stroll along to the South Foreland Lighthouse - the first in the world to have electric light.There are a wide range of societies and clubs including bowls, tennis, cricket, football as well as a history and horticultural society, among many others. The excellent primary school has been voted Outstanding by Ofsted.For those with an interest in boating and sailing there are local marinas, yachting and dinghy sailing clubs. There is good access to London and beyond by road and rail while the village is also well served by buses. listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.

listing.description: Cartmel Lodge is a luxurious, four bedroom property located within this small exclusive gated development. The ground floor offers three reception rooms, all beautifully finished with feature walls, a wonderful kitchen diner/family room that looks out onto the garden and incorporates Terrazzo flooring sourced by Diespeker & Co, utility room and cloakroom. To the first floor are the four bedrooms, the master bedroom benefitting from gloss walnut finish fitted furniture, walk-in wardrobe and en suite, bedroom two is also en suite and the two further bedrooms are also newly decorated and benefit from gloss white storage, the family bathroom has been finished with Emperor marble to give a high end result. listing.description: Location  The house is approached via a sought after cul-de-sac within a short walk of the pretty town of Oxted. This unusually quiet plot, measured in the region of about a third of an acre has an enviable elevated position taking advantage of some far reaching, westerly views. This commuter town is surrounded by National Trust land, and boasts the ever popular Master Park offering year round events. Oxted and Hurst Green stations (both within walking distance) provide mainline services to East Croydon and central London (London Bridge and Victoria - 30-40 minutes). The town includes a Leisure Complex with swimming pool, Independent boutique Cinema and a range of shops including a Morrisons and a Waitrose. Junction 6 of the M25 is approximately 3 miles distant. There are a number of good local state and independent schools for all ages, some within walking distance. These include Limpsfield and Downs Way Infant Schools, St Mary's Junior School and Oxted Secondary School in the state sector and Hazelwood School in the independent sector.Property description  Built in 1960, this detached family home was extended approximately 15 years ago but still has the potential for further building work (subject to planning) and modernisation. There is a useful brick built porch with a window to the front and tiled floor leading to the spacious entrance hall. You are immediately struck by the bright and airy feel to this home. The entrance hall provides two storage cupboards and access to the rest of the well laid out accommodation. To the right is a large room, formerly two separate rooms. The front of this area is the sitting room with an attractive brick built working fire place with tiled hearth and a window to the side. The lounge is to the rear of the house with sliding patio doors to the garden and a box bay window to the side giving fabulous, elevated westerly views. The kitchen/dining room runs across the back of the house. The kitchen has a range of wall and base units with worktop over, a stainless steel 1 1/2 bowl sink with mixer tap and drainer set beneath the window, an integrated double oven, inset hob with extractor over, space for a dishwasher and a larder cupboard. The kitchen opens to the dining room with sliding doors accessing the rear garden. The utility room sits to the side providing space and plumbing for a washing machine, tumble dryer and fridge/freezer. The family room sits to the front of the house and can be accessed from both the hall and dining area. A cloakroom with w.C., wash hand basin and mirror with light completes the ground floor accommodation.The stairs to the landing splits at the top giving access to the two newer rooms on the left and the three original bedrooms on the right. To the right the dual aspect, spacious master bedroom benefits from a south-west facing balcony perfect for watching sunsets and overlooks the garden and views beyond. Bedroom two is also a generous double size with westerly views over the garden and bedroom three is also a good size double with plenty of space to put wardrobes and other furniture. The two newer rooms are slightly smaller, one with southerly views overlooking the garden, the other with eaves storage and views to the north. One of the bathrooms is conveniently located between these two bedrooms and offers a bath with shower over, wash hand basin, w.C. And airing cupboard. The landing provides access to the spacious loft that is part boarded and has a light and ladder. The family bathroom has a bath with shower over and wash hand basin with the w.C. Located next to the bathroom.Outside  Set on a quiet, residential road and sits in a nicely secluded spot. There is a large driveway to the front of the house providing off road parking for a number of cars. The south west facing plot is surrounded by attractive mature hedging and lies to the side and rear of the house positioned to capture the best of the sun. The garden is mainly laid to lawn with a patio running to the side and rear of the house. A handy gated side passageway provides a path and access to the utility room. There are two sheds tucked away in a corner of the garden.The best bits...  Excellent opportunity to put your own stamp on a good sized family home on a plot that is not over looked on a very popular road within walking distance of Oxted town and its mainline station.

Set behind private gates ensuring privacy and independence, this exclusive four bedroom detached residence will deliver in every aspect, with many benefits including the possibility of both commercial use and a real opportunity of further development subject to normal statutory planning permission…….So an opportunity not to be missed !

This leads to a light and airy living room, with front and rear aspect, together with a well appointed kitchen/diner, perfect for getting together as a family for breakfast, or at any time of the day, with plenty of work space and storage for a large family. The far from modest conservatory accessed either form the aforementioned kitchen, or giving access to the side, gives perfect and far reaching views over the rear garden, affording you the ability to be at one with outside, whatever the weather. Externally, the property boasts a wealth of space, with a Pool house, and additional outbuildings together with a undercover car port to house your vehicles in the land to the rear of the plot. There’s also additional storage space with a good sized detached garage, with additional office space to boot, perfect for working from home if this is your want. There also a storage room overhead the garage, providing more much needed space, which you may be able to put to good use, or use potentially as a games room. listing.letting_fees:
For a detailed version of Lawlors Services & Fees Explained, please visit our website: Or ask a member of staff.


Lawlors services & fees explained


Note: All charges listed below are the maximum fees that will be applied depending on both your circumstances and the number of tenants. At Lawlors we aim to be as transparent as possible when disclosing any charges or fees. Please bear in mind changes such as seasonal promotions do occur so contact our lettings branch directly for an accurate assessment of your rental needs.


Tenancy application/references


When a suitable property to rent has been found all persons aged eighteen or over will complete an Application Form and will be named in the Tenancy Agreement. We will take up references on behalf of our client, your landlord, which may include a bank reference for which your bank may charge a nominal fee, a credit reference, an employer's reference, an accountant¿s reference, and a previous landlord reference. A payment to indicate your commitment is required when you submit your application and is held against expenses and fees incurred. If your application is successful this payment will be deducted from your Initial Money. The payment is non-refundable should your application be unsuccessful or withdrawn in certain circumstances, the details of which are set out in the tinfo (Tenant Information Sheet). Please note that this payment in advance does not constitute a tenancy or offer of a tenancy but is proof of your serious intention to proceed.


Tenancy agreement


Before any tenancy begins you will sign a Tenancy Agreement setting out the landlord's and tenant's obligations. A charge of £250 is made for the preparation of the
original Agreement and a further £100 for any extension Agreement(s) subsequently entered into. Once the Tenancy Agreement has been executed by you and the
landlord it is binding. Should your circumstances changes and the tenancy agreement need amending at any point during the tenancy you must inform us and, subject to your landlord's agreement (which might include the need to take up new references) we will prepare new documents for signature. Our fee for this will be £300 plus any applicable referencing.


Security deposit


Before your tenancy commences you will be required to pay a security deposit which will be a minimum of one month's rent. This deposit is held by us as stakeholders or passed to your landlord. The deposit is held against any damages or expenses arising during your tenancy and will not be released until after you vacate the property, all rent has been paid up to date and we have written confirmation of any costs for damages from both parties. No interest on'the deposit is payable to either party.

The Initial Money consists of:
- First month's rent (Subject to Landlord)
- Security Deposit, minimum one month's rent
- Administration Fee one week's rent
- Full Referencing Fee £144 per tenant
- Part Referencing Fee £60 per tenant
- If there are any guarantors to the tenancy:
- Guarantor Referencing Fee £144 per guarantor
- Guarantor Agreement Fee £150

If the tenant is a company:
- Company Referencing Fee £144 per company

Other Charges:
- Additional copy of tenancy agreement £25
- Change of Sharer £250
- Extension Agreements £100
- Missed Appointment Charge £30

End of tenancy:
- Outgoing reference fee £35
- Locksmith administration and attendance charge £100

Optional extras:
- Express Move-In within 3 days £150

listing.letting_fees:
Once you have decided on a suitable property to rent then there are various costs that you will need to take into consideration when making an offer. Garton Jones have outlined our process and the charges below:

Rental Price Calculator

We advertise all of our properties on a ‘per week’ basis and the method used to calculate the monthly rental is the weekly figure multiplied by 52 weeks in the year and then divided by 12 months (for example £450pw x 52 / 12 = £1950pcm)

Fee’s

Once your offer has been accepted then we will require a one week holding deposit as well as a £60 referencing fee (payable per tenant). This will ensure the we cease marketing and that the property is placed under offer whilst our independent referencing agency carry out reference checks

Reference Fee: £60 inc VAT (same fee applies for guarantors)

Company Reference Fee: £120 inc VAT

listing.description: A converted stone barn with over 3500 sq ft of flexible internal accommodation and stunning views with gardens and land totalling about 5.3 acres.Trigon House was developed in the late 1980s from an impressive stone barn that it is believed used to house the farm's hay wagons and the reason for the arches in the front elevation. It is built of stone elevations under pitched tiled roofs andprovides spacious internal accommodation over three floors. From the front there is an entrance to a large central hall, to one side there is a billiard room able to accommodate a full sized snooker table and to the other side a double guest room with ensuite bathroom and to the rear a cloakroom and laundry. A staircase leads to the first floor where there is a dual aspect drawing room with feature stone fireplace, sitting room, kitchen with Aga opening into a large dining room giving a great open plan family or entertaining space. A door from the kitchen opens to a south west facing terrace ideal for al fresco dining. All rooms have good ceiling heights and large windows making the most of the wonderful far-reaching views. On the second floor there are three double bedrooms, a dressing room and family bathroom with the master bedroom having an ensuite bathroom. The garden is mainly to the rear of the house and is neatly landscaped, private and full of flowers and shrubs giving plenty of colour. A 5 bar gate leads to the stables, woodland and paddocks.The property is approached via a carriage drive, lined with trees, mature hedging and flower and herbaceous borders, to a large parking area and double garage. There is a terraced area leading to a gently sloping landscaped garden, mainly laid to lawn with mature trees, flowerbeds and shrub borders. A 5 bar gate leads to the stable block with two loose boxes, garden store, kennel and small copse. The land comprises a mixture of woodland and two paddocks totalling 5.36 acres.
listing.short_description: A converted stone barn with over 3500 sq ft of flexible internal accommodation and stunning views with gardens and land totalling about 5.3 acres. (contd...)

listing.description: A beautifully presented character conversion of former Coach House and stables, with 5 bedrooms and 4 separate reception rooms, a fabulous 3 room annexe and a triple garage. The property backs directly on to fields and boasts stunning views towards Farnham, situated in a peaceful yet highly convenient location within easy reach of both Farnham and Guildford town centres. EPC rating D.The property has been updated and extended to a high specification and offers generous and versatile living accommodation throughout.Corner Hoppit is set well back from the Guildford Road in a very private position backing on to open fields, approached by a long driveway with electric gates. The driveway then splits to the entrance of the property and leads under an integral archway in to a private courtyard with parking for several vehicles and on to an attached triple garage with remote electric doors.The accommodation is arranged over two floors and includes five bedrooms and six reception rooms.Both the spacious master bedroom and guest bedroom enjoy their own modern ensuite shower rooms. Bedroom 5 is situated next to the master and is currently used as a dressing room but could equally be a good single bedroom or nursery.Bedroom 3 and 4 interlink and work equally well as individual bedrooms or as a bedroom and child’s den/playroom. The family bathroom has also been refitted.The property backs directly on to open fields with far reaching westerly views towards Farnham. When walking through the property you find yourself staring out at perfectly framed postcard views from many of the windows.The kitchen has been refitted with a range of modern high gloss pale grey units with granite work surfaces and a central island with integrated appliances. There is a separate utility room that leads off the kitchen, which has a door on to the rear garden.Of particular note is the fabulous and extremely versatile annex, which is linked linked to the main house by the covered entrance archway. It is currently used as a spacious hobbies room, a generous home office with air conditioning and temperature controlled wine store. It could easily be converted to a self contained flat.Outside, the landscaped gardens wrap around the property. There is a level lawned area and various entertaining areas. A patio terrace leads off of the dining room and is flanked by raised planted beds and a water feature. This area is a wonderful terrace to enjoy the morning sun for breakfast. In all the total plot extends to approximately one third of an acre.Overall, this is a magnificent property and must be viewed to fully appreciate the quality on offer in this peaceful and yet highly convenient position within easy reach of both Farnham and Guildford town centres as well as direct access on to the national motorway network.Situation – The property is situated in the village of Runfold. A sought after village within the Surrey Hills Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, adjacent to the villages of Seale and The Sands, between Farnham (approx. 2 miles) and Guildford (approx. 8 miles). The property is ideally situated with fast access on to the A31 and A331, connecting to the national motorway network (M3 approx 8 miles and Heathrow approx 26 miles). There is a choice of railway stations nearby at Guildford (Waterloo 38 mins), Ash vale and Farnham (Waterloo 54 mins). Schools in the area are 1st class, with Barfield prep school on the doorstep and rgs, Charterhouse, Aldro, Edgeborough, Frensham Heights, Moor House and Lord Wandsworth, to name a few, are all close by.

listing.description: A superbly appointed five bedroom, three reception, semi-detached family home, solidly built in 1904, situated towards the end of this attractive tree-lined suburban road on the highly sought-after Bathwick Estate. Close to excellent schools, including Bathwick St. Mary’s and King Edward’s, beautiful parks and the city centre.The accommodation briefly consists of entrance hall, living room, dining room/study, breakfast room, kitchen and downstairs cloakroom. On the first floor, there are four bedrooms, including master/en-suite, two further double bedrooms and a generous single, as well as the family bathroom. Enclosed mature garden to the rear and off street parking to the front.Entrance PorchPeriod feature tiled floor. Hardwood glazed front door.Entrance Hall9'04" x 4'04"Inset coir mat. Stripped floor boards. Radiator. Ornate coving. Stairs to the first floor.Living Room15'09" in to bay x 14'05"Bay window with sash windows. Feature cast iron fireplace. High ceilings, ornate coving and stripped floor. Double radiator.Reception Room13'03 x 12'11"High ceilings with ornate coving. Two rear aspect sash windows. Stripped floor. Double radiator.Downstairs CloakroomWith wall mounted hand wash basin, W.C. And extractor.Dining Room16' x 12'03"Two side aspect sash windows. Two double radiators. Storage built in to the alcove. Half glazed door to the kitchen.Kitchen12'03" x 12'03"Fitted with a range of base and eye level units with Oak work tops. Ceramic one and a half bowl ceramic sink. Space for an American fridge freezer, washing machine and dryer. Space for a range cooker with extractor over. Integral dishwasher. Rear aspect window over looking the garden. Side aspect hardwood glazed door and side aspect window. Tiled floor. Double radiator. Tiled splash-backs. Downlighters.First FloorSpilt level landing. Radiator. Dado rail. High ceilings.Staircase with painted spindled and wooden balustrade.Bedroom One15'09" in to bay x 12'09"Front aspect bay window, feature fireplace, stripped floors, high ceilings with ornate coving. Double radiator.En-Suite9' x 6'04"A full bathroom located next to the master bedroom. With separate shower cubicle, panel enclosed bath, pedestal hand wash basin and W.C. Front aspect sash window. Radiator. Part tiled walls. Downlighters.Bedroom Two13'03 x 13'03"A good sized double bedroom. Stripped floor, two sash windows to the rear aspect. Double radiator.Bathroom5'10 x 8'10"Shower cubicle with thermostatic shower, panel enclosed bath with shower attachment, pedestal hand wash basin and W.C. Side aspect obscure sash window. Tiled floor. Heated towel rail/radiator. Downllighters.Bedroom Three13'04" x 12'03"Located to the rear of the property with wonderful views. Fitted wardrobe and a feature fireplace. Radiator.Bedroom Four9' x 9'01"Side aspect sash window. Fitted wardrobe. Radiator.Second FloorA wide landing, currently used as an office area. Velux window to the rear aspect. Eves storage. Door to the loft room/bedroom.Loft Room11'05" x 12'02"A double bedroom. Rear aspect double glazed window with great views. Eves storage and radiator.Rear GardenAn enclosed rear garden. With patio area close to the house. Leading to a lawned area with mature shrubs and trees. Silver birch, ornamental cherry trees. Laurel and magnolia. A wooden pagoda leads to a pond and shed to the rear of the garden. Gated side access.Off Road ParkingOff street parking to the front of the property.LocationThe house occupies a convenient location in the highly desirable area of Bathwick, a short level walk to the wide range of shops and facilities in Bath City centre. Further amenities including a Tesco Express can be found nearby at the bottom of Bathwick Hill as well as various local bus routes in and out of the city. A range of excellent State and Private schools are situated in the local area including King Edward’s School, Bathwick St Mary, Bathampton Primary and Widcombe Junior School. Bath Golf Club, Bath University and Bath Spa Railway Station are only a short distance away, with wonderful walks in neighbouring countryside or along the Kennet and Avon Canal very easily accessible. At the end of Forester Road is Bath Boating Station and The Bathwick Boatman Riverside Restaurant.Local AreaForester Road is situated in an established and convenient residential area. There are local shopping facilities at Bathwick Street and the City Centre with all its amenities is within level walking distance via Great Pulteney Street and Henrietta Park.There are two extremely well regarded primary schools at Bathwick (Bathwick St Mary’s) and Widcombe (Widcombe C of E Junior School) and a third further away at Larkhall. Additionally, there is King Edward’s in the vicinity, an excellent private school. The Kennet & Avon Canal with its towpath is a local feature nearby.Forester Road is an attractive Edwardian semi-detached house which retains many original period features including sash windows within the bays to the front, beautiful ornamental fireplaces in a number of rooms, exposed wooden floors, attractive staircase and ceiling picture rails. The house provides spacious and flexible accommodation over three floors.

listing.description: Elegant Four Bedroom Period Classic With Bright Tasteful FinishThis fine four bedroom Victorian gem is definitely one to view! The living accommodation is spread over three floors and you have a large corner plot including a sunny rear and side garden with side access. The interior is tastefully presented, conducive to modern living with two smart bathrooms, a contemporary kitchen adjoining the bright living space and four double bedrooms. The current owners have secured planning permission for a double storey side return and rear extension. If you're looking for a project to sink your teeth into, we have the architect plans available.Entering on the raised ground floor you'll be pleased to find original dado rails separating complimentary wall shades. Rich hardwood flooring runs from the hall into the bright rear facing well stocked kitchen. Here you'll fall in love with thick solid counters, sleek white cabinets, a one and a half bowl sink and drainer and a cracking five ring gas range. There's a pretty garden view through a wooden framed sash over the sink. The reception adjoins the kitchen, where a slightly arched front facing sash boasts stripped wooden shutters.The lower return hosts a handy utility and wc which is light and lovely owing to its triple aspect. To the rear, a south–facing patio area and lush healthy lawn make for the perfect bbq venue. Back inside, moving downstairs finds you inspecting the first two double bedrooms. The larger bedroom benefits from fitted shelving units. There's another bathroom on this level and plenty of storage under the stairs. Up to the first return you'll discover a nicely presented bathroom with Travertine floor, wall and counter tiling, bath and shower and vintage radiator. The first floor hosts two more light and airy double bedrooms - the main bedroom with twin sash windows overlooking the front garden, has handy fitted wardrobes. The property also benefits from ample storage, with a loft, cellar and garden shed. Parking is easy as the road is in an unrestricted parking zone.Well located for Rye Lane, Camberwell Green and Kings College Hospital, the house is less than a 10-minute walk to Peckham Rye station (zone 2) for Victoria, London Bridge and Blackfriars. Peckham Rye also has the London Overground Line, with great connections to Clapham Junction, Canada Water and trendy East London. Several buses run into town along the nearby Peckham Road, with just a 15 minute ride to Elephant & Castle or Oval tube stations. Bellenden Road, with delis, cafés and award-winning butcher, is a quick stroll through Warwick Gardens. Also within walking distance are numerous local highlights: Alsop and Stormer’s Peckham library, the contemporary South London Gallery and a Sunday Farmers Market on Camberwell Green, which has recently reopened after a £13m refurbishment.

listing.letting_fees:
When renting a property with Currell, please be aware that fees will apply during the process. Details of these fees are as follows:

Administration Fees (Non-optional)
We charge £240 (including VAT) to cover the cost of administration of the tenancy. For clarity, this is a charge per tenancy and not per applicant.

Referencing Fees (Non-optional)
We use an independent referencing agency (rmt - Reference-My-Tenant) to carry out reference checks on all tenants. The cost of these checks are £40 (including VAT) per individual joining the tenancy and £50 (including VAT) if a company is being referenced. For clarity, each individual named in the tenancy agreement will need to pay a referencing fee. For example, 3 tenants = 3 referencing fees.

Check-In Fees (Non optional in the event that the Landlord uses the services of an Independent Inventory Clerk)
We use an independent inventory company (normally Ready Report) to carry out a Check-In and Check-Out service on all properties (subject to the landlord confirming that they wish to use this service). The cost of a check-in and check-out are identical and can vary from £108 (including VAT) to £240 (including VAT) dependent on the size of property and the amount of furnishings in the property. Most normally, tenants pay for a check-in and landlords pay for the check-out. For clarity, check in fees are payable per tenancy, not per applicant.

Early Termination (Non-optional in the event of leaving earlier than the tenancy allows)

A fundamental responsibility as a tenant is to pay your rent, but we recognize there may be circumstances whereby you need to break out of your tenancy early. If your Landlord agrees that the property can be re advertised, in order to find a suitable replacement tenant to take over your liability, you still need to continue making your regular rent payments until a new tenant takes occupation. In addition you will need to cover the Landlords fees for the unexpired term of your tenancy. These fees are calculated on a pro rata basis. Should you be thinking of leaving earlier than your tenancy agreement permits, you should contact your local branch as soon as possible for a detailed breakdown of the costs involved.

Other Fees

Currell also works on behalf of institutional, rather than private, Landlords who may have their own administration procedures and fees. This can mean that the costs vary from those detailed above. Details of these fees are available upon request, but please be assured that if these landlords charge fees then you will not be liable to pay any fees to us.

listing.description: This architecturally striking residence is delightfully located on the rural fringes of the village of Bapchild, which itself is conveniently close to the popular town of Sittingbourne - which now offers high speed rails services to the capital.The property itself offers sumptuous period character throughout and is currently configured with six bedrooms and three reception rooms. A large kitchen is complimented by a southerly facing garden room and the practicality of large cellarage.The property is attached on its western side to a small cottage that if additionally acquired could return a solid investment yield or be used as originally intended as an annexe to the main house. The cottage is tenanted but could be purchased via separate negotiation.The main property sits within wonderful grounds of fine lawns with established borders and mature trees. The property is approached by a sweeping tree lined private drive that dramatically opens and affords a stunning view of the front and side of the residence.The driveway extends to offer very generous levels of parking and further more leads to a two bay garage building with powered doors.Entrance  Twin outer doors opening into pillared entrance porch. Glazed inner door opening into:Entrance hallway  Shuttered sash window to front. Arched alcove. Fireplace opening with ornate surround. Storage closet and under-stairs storage cupboard. Radiators. Fitted carpet.Sitting room  Walk in bay with sash window and window seat with ornate plaster work. French doors to garden with plantation shutters. Large fireplace opening with ornate plasterwork and friezes. Built in storage cupboards. Radiators. Fitted carpet.Dining room  Three pairs of curved shuttered French doors opening to garden. Patterned leaded windows to side. Marble fireplace surround. Radiators. Fitted carpet.Drawing room  Sash shuttered window to front. Large fireplace with surround. Arched recess. Radiator. Fitted carpet.Kitchen/breakfast room  Sash window and door to rear. One and a half bowl sink unit formed within a Corian work-surface. Inset five ring gas hob. Range of cupboard and drawer base units. Integrated fridge. Plumbing for washing machine. Upright cabinet housing electric oven. Range of eye level wall cabinets incorporating extractor hood. Glass fronted display units and wine rack. Circular Corian breakfast bar. Radiator. Tiled floor.Garden room  Of rendered brick & timber construction. Vaulted ceiling with powered openers. Tiled floor with under floor heating.Ground floor W.C.  Window to rear. Low level close coupled W.C. Wall mounted wash hand basin. Electric towel rail/radiator.Cellar  Stone staircase to large triple chamber cellar. Power and light. Housing additional appliances and gas fired boiler.Staircase to first floor  Curved staircase. Hand rail and balustrade. Fitted carpet.Landing  Overhead octagonal light well. Double glazed skylight window. Airing cupboard housing hot water cylinder. Three closets. Radiators. Fitted carpet.Master bedroom  Three windows two shuttered to rear. Extensive range of fitted bedroom furniture. Radiators. Fitted carpet.Dressing room  Window to rear. Range of fitted storage. Dressing table with Corian top. Fitted carpet. Open plan to:En-suite  Window to rear. Panelled bath with mixer taps. Low level close coupled W.C. Pedestal wash hand basin. Large power shower enclosure. Local wall tiling. Radiator/towel rail. Amtico tiled floor.Bedroom  Sash window to front. Fireplace surround. Built in closet. Radiator. Fitted carpet.Bedroom  Sash window to front. Built in wardrobe. Radiator. Fitted carpet.Bedroom  Sash window to front. Fireplace surround. Built in closets. Radiator. Fitted carpet.Bedroom  Window to side and French doors opening onto a Juliet balcony. Built in wardrobes & dressing table. Radiator. Fitted carpet.Bedroom  Sash windows to rear and side. Built in wardrobes & dressing table. Radiator. Fitted carpet.Family bathroom  Window to rear. Low level close coupled W.C. Bidet. Pedestal wash hand basin. Spa bath. Local wall tiling. Radiator. Fitted carpet.Frontage  Large lawn area flanked by a wide variety of trees and shrubs.Side & rear walled gardens  Extensive lawns areas with well stocked borders. Large paved patio areas with central raised flower bed. Brick built garden store and greenhouse.Driveway  Tarmac tree lined driveway edged by a lawn area with a mature specimen fir tree and seating area.Parking area  Block paved parking area in front of garage plus extensive tarmac parking area in front of main house.Garaging  Double width garage building with powered doors. Window to side. Overhead storage.Attached cottage  (available strictly by separate negotiation approached by separate driveway). Ground floor comprises of an entrance hall, kitchen, lounge/diner. The first floor comprises of two double bedrooms and bathroom. Offered with an enclosed rear garden and a single garage.Accesses and rights of ways  It should be note that rights of way exist on the foremost sections of the approach driveway which allow access to the neighbouring home.

listing.description: Part exchange considered Wow.......An Elegantly Extended Detached House In The Heart Of Worsley! Occupying a commanding position on Sefton Drive. A simply outstanding detached family home which offers an abundance of space and luxurious living. This is a prestigious property with an understated elegance and the warmth and a welcoming feel of a real family home. The property leads you into an elegant entrance hall, through to a sumptuous lounge and sitting room, a fantastic state of the art dining kitchen, substantial dining/cinema room and at the heart of this home is a fabulous family room with outstanding views over the garden. A superb gymnasium and sauna for two. A study, ground floor cloakroom and utility room complete the ground floor. On the first floor are four very spacious and stylish bedrooms, three with impressive en-suite bathrooms, a laundry room offers the option of a 6th bedroom or small nursery. On the second floor a lavish double bedroom and full size en-suite bathroom .To the rear of the property is what can only be described as a 'glamorous' garden with a lavish decked terrace, patio and sun deck, a superb lawn leading to the bottom of the garden and out into Worsley woods if you choose.  Set in a substantial plot where the grounds are incredibly private. If you love entertaining or just having family gatherings at your house, this property has the open areas you need to pull off a great party. Located just off Worsley Road very close to 'The Green and Worsley Village and the beautiful Bridgewater Canal. From here you can simply walk into the village and along the canal. This is a very sought after location, close to Worsley woods so there are some stunning local walks, superb local restaurants and local bars. The property is well positioned for access to the M60, M61 Trafford Centre and Manchester Airport.Entrance Hall - 19' 1'' x 9' 11'' (5.81m x 3.02m)You enter this property into an elegant and spacious reception hallway, this stunning hallway is bright and airy, it has a modern finish but with a period twist. An impressive staircase leads to the first floor with a spindle banister and leads to a 'Mezzanine' style landing, the hallway is finished with a beautiful 'Travertine' style marble tiled floor, a period feature door and side window lead through to garden room, stylish light fittings, storage cupboard and cornice to the ceiling.Lounge - 19' 1'' x 13' 11'' (5.81m x 4.24m)A stylish and spacious lounge with a Upvc double glazed window to the front, traditional coal effect living flame gas fire set in a limestone inset, hearth and fire surround, solid wood doors lead through to the sitting room, stripped and stained flooring, two radiators and coving to the ceiling.Sitting Room - 13' 11'' x 11' 11'' (4.24m x 3.63m)A beautiful sitting room with gorgeous views over the rear garden, built in traditional style shelving and storage to one elevation, stripped and stained floors, a large Upvc double glazed window makes the most of the view and makes this a lovely light room, solid wood double doors lead through to the family room.Family Room - 20' 5'' x 11' 11'' (6.22m x 3.63m)A fabulous family room which just floods with natural light, superb Bi-Folding doors pull back to really bring the outside in and make the most of the views over the gorgeous garden, three double glazed Velux skylights simply add to the light, benefiting from under floor heating, this room is partially open to the kitchen and solid wood double doors lead to the dining room. It is this area of the house where you get a real sense of the fantastic entertaining space this property offers, boasting a real flexibility with the space which can opened up fully for entertaining or closed up to create private reception areas...The choice is yours!Dining Room - 15' 5'' x 11' 11'' (4.70m x 3.63m)A substantial dining room which again is perfect for dinner parties or sporting events with space for a large cinema screen, a Upvc double glazed window to the rear, walnut effect flooring, built in ceiling speakers, part open plan to the kitchen diner, radiator.Kitchen Diner - 20' 9'' x 11' 5'' (6.32m x 3.48m)A simply stunning dining kitchen which really is at the heart of this home, part open to a beautiful dining room and gorgeous family room offering a superb open plan family area. Presenting a contemporary, minimalistic Earl & Ginger kitchen, using dark lavish hi-gloss and atmospheric lighting this is a very glamorous kitchen. Featuring a comprehensive range of high gloss black wall and base units, a brightly lit 'Hot Pink' breakfast pantry, L shaped centre island with built in wine chiller, large pan drawers, five ring Siemens' gas hob with a Prestige extractor by 'Falmec', carved sink with a 'Quooker' instant hot water tap and contemporary mixer taps, extended work top creates are bar area with space for stools and three drop down 'Tom Dixon' lights, two Siemens built in electric ovens, glassware unit, large 'Siemens' fridge freezer, black high gloss granite tiled floor and recessed spot lighting.Utility Room - 10' 2'' x 7' 10'' (3.10m x 2.39m)A great room just off the kitchen with ample space for washing machine and dishwasher, granite effect work tops, sink and drainer, black granite hi- gloss floor and a door to the rear, large cupboard houses the Vallient boiler and an unvented cylinder.Downstairs WCAn elegant cloakroom incorporating low level WC with a concealed flush, contemporary hand basin with mixer tap, black granite tiled floor and mirror.Gym - 20' 7'' x 9' 10'' (6.27m x 2.99m)A fantastic home gymnasium with separate wood boarded sauna, wall mounted mirror, space for a large selection of gym equipment. A Upvc double glazed window to the front and rear staircase leads to the first floor with spindle banister, wood effect floor.Study - 15' 0'' x 11' 7'' (4.57m x 3.53m)A superb home office or additional reception room with a Upvc double glazed window to the front, traditional living flame gas fire set in a stone tiled inset and hearth, radiator and spotlights.First Floor LandingA light and airy landing with in a feature 'Mezzanine' style with spindle banister. A Upvc double glazed window to the front aspect and doors to all first floor bedrooms, ceiling coving.Master Bedroom & Ensuite - 19' 0'' x 11' 9'' (5.79m x 3.58m)A lavish master bedroom with elegant mirror fronted wardrobes, a fabulous floor to ceiling shoe cupboard which only a girl would truly appreciate! Finished with a solid oak floor, Upvc double glazed window to the front and radiator.En-Suite 13'11 x 12'0A luxurious and ample master bathroom suite, fitted with a five piece bathroom suite comprising of a low level W.C with concealed flush, his and hers wall mounted hand basins with large vanity mirror, large free standing curved bath with contemporary mixer tap, large tiled 'walk in' wet room shower with shower head, thermostatic valve and stool, under floor heating, slate effect tiling to two elevations and four Upvc double glazed windows to the rear elevation let in lots of natural light......Simply stunning!Bedroom With En-Suite - 12' 7'' x 11' 7'' (3.83m x 3.53m)A stylish double bedroom with a Upvc double glazed window to the rear, his and hers double wardrobes offer ample hanging and shelving, walnut wood effect floor, coving and radiator.En-Suite 6'11 x 5'7An attractive en-suite incorporating a bath with traditional style shower head and mixer tap, hand basin and low level WC, white wall and floor tiling, extractor.Bedroom - 12' 9'' x 8' 3'' (3.88m x 2.51m)A well presented double room with a Upvc double glazed window to the front, built in wardrobes and radiator.Bedroom & En-Suite - 18' 0'' x 12' 11'' (5.48m x 3.93m)A large double bedroom with a Upvc double glazed window to the front, spotlights and radiator.En-Suite 10'2 x 9'8A large en-suite bathroom incorporating a low level WC bath and hand basin both with mixer taps, shower enclosure, shower head and slider rail. Ceramic tiled floor and walls, radiator.Laundry Room - 10' 1'' x 8' 3'' (3.07m x 2.51m)The laundry room could have many uses depending on preference, with a Upvc double glazed window to the rear, built in wardrobes offering hanging and shelving, radiator.Second Floor LandingWith a Upvc double glazed window to the front, staircase and spindle banister, a door to the double bedroom and a door to the en-suite.Second Floor Bedroom - 19' 3'' x 9' 3'' (5.86m x 2.82m)A fantastic double bedroom with Upvc double glazed French door which open to a Juliet balcony and the most magnificent views of the rear garden and beyond, large walk in dressing area with a Velux skylight to the front. Radiator and spotlights.Second Floor En-Suite - 13' 11'' x 11' 0'' (4.24m x 3.35m)An impressive en-suite incorporating a his & hers 'Heritage' hand basins with storage under, simply huge walk in double wet room shower with mosaic tiling, 'Travertine' style ceramic tiled floor, low level WC, heated towel rail and spotlights.OutsideWith a commanding position on Sefton Road in Worsley, set in substantial plot with a superb 'in & out block paved driveway to the front, mature plants and shrubs to the borders and side gate for access. It is the rear garden which truly sets this property aside, a fabulous extension of the interior with the most superb decked terrace with ample space for garden furniture, a perfect place for relaxing outside with friends, a separate patio finished in Indian stone is ideal for outside dining, a fantastic lawn and pathway leads you down to sun deck at the bottom of the garden with an elegant water feature and an amazing view looking back up at this outstanding property. This a very private garden, with Worsley woods beyond. Property has solar panels to part of the roof.LocalityLocated just off Worsley Road very close to 'The Green and Worsley Village and the beautiful Bridgewater Canal. From her you can simply walk into the village and along the canal. This is a very sought after location, close to Worsley woods so there are some stunning local walks, superb local restaurants and local bars. The property is well positioned for access to the M60, M61 Trafford Centre and Manchester Airport.Additional InformationThe vendors have advised us that the property is FreeholdCouncil Tax band GSolar Panels to part of the roof

listing.description: Possibly one of the highest quality built houses in Lytchett Matravers and with a panoramic view of the Purbecks, we are delighted to offer for sale this modern contemporary styled detached four bedroom house.A individual designed house built to bespoke specification and located upon a raised elevated plot with extensive views of the Purbeck Hills. Combining high quality fittings with stylish design tinged with an art deco theme running through the property, Glebe Road is both rare to find and a delight to behold. Offering generous accommodation set over three floors and utilising the latest technology available to ensure the most comfortable home life, this property requires immediate viewing to be appreciated. For further information and discreet appointments to view please contact Chris Bryan on .Property Access:Via a remote controlled sliding gate leading to the main drive and house. A two car drive enclosed within a wrap around garden that surrounds the property. A remote roller shutter door gives leave to the integral garageThe Ground FloorEntrance Hall:With access to all ground floor principal reception rooms, striking effect flooring coupled with reflecting decor incorporating oak doors to cloakroom and boiler room, smoothed ceiling with inset lighters.Kitchen:A state of the art and practical culinary working area with stylish working surfaces, soft close cupboards and integrated high end appliances. As part of an open plan ground floor living area the kitchen is strategically well located to harmonise with the dining area opposite. Benefiting from strong use of natural light due to the positioning of the window apertures with rural views to both front and rear elevations which are visible from most stand points in this, the hub of any home. Underfloor heating with premium floor covering adds considerable pleasure and warmth to the surrounds. External access to the rear garden is through sliding patio doors whilst a internal door leads to the Utility Room along with internal access to the integral garage.Dining Aspect:A beautiful aspect room to be used for entertaining with outstanding Southerly rural views over green belt countryside and open farm land. The continuation of the themed decor and use of blending colours make this a perfect proposition for evening dinner parties in which to impress your guests.Living Room:The focal point of the ground floor accommodation and a place to unwind and relax from the working day. A solid fuel log burner brings a cosy open fire into the living room for those winter evenings whilst the morning, afternoon and late evening sun can be captured and enjoyed capturing outstanding rural views through the triple aspect range of windows that this formidable reception room enjoys. Sliding patio doors allow access to the gardens upon which evening entertaining in the summer by way of barbeque or canapes in order to savour the spectacular Dorset countryside is a natural thing to do. The latest in entertainment systems brings everything that the TV and film industry has to offer.The First FloorA floating glass and light oak staircase leads from the Entrance Hall to the First Floor. From here direct access leads to:The Bedrooms:Relax. Unwind. Sleep. A sumptuous range of three bedrooms, including Master Suite, that occupy the whole of the floor. Unrivalled views of the surrounding countryside are enjoyed from whatever bedroom is occupied and each bedroom has access to its own personal en-suite facility offering the latest in high quality bathroom furniture, and sensor lighting. From the Master Bedroom doors lead to a South Facing Balcony in which to drink in the wrap around rural and harbour views that show the County of Dorset at its best.The Second FloorA practical and well thought out floor which has the versatility of being either a bedroom or a study. Spacious in size and contemporary by design with outstanding views of the Purbeck Hills through large double glazed windows manufactured to the highest specifications.  A luxury bathroom (en-suite in the case of use as a bedroom) is incorporated into the second floor with sensor lighting and high quality bathroom furniture.The GardensThe gardens are fully landscaped with an excellent use of raised patios coupled with laid to lawn areas. Located adjacent to open fields and countryside, they offer privacy, seclusion and quiet enjoyment.About Lytchett MatraversLocated around six miles from the Port of Poole, and market towns of Wareham and Wimborne, Lytchett Matravers is a historic village that is mentioned in the Domesday Book and pronounced as Litchet. Offering a diverse range of architecture within the village ranging from 14th Century buildings to later style contemporary design, the village is surrounded by a sea of green belt countryside. Local facilities offer supermarket, general stores and butchery, hairdressing and post office. A two tier education system sees the local village Primary School in strong demand, whilst leisure interests are served by a diverse range of sporting representations ranging from football to horse riding. With a density of around 2100 dwellings, the village is large enough to matter but small enough to care.Consumer Protection from Unfair Trading Regulations 2008.The Agent has not tested any apparatus, equipment, fixtures and fittings or services and so cannot verify that they are in working order or fit for the purpose. listing.description: SummaryDolcoath is a substantial family home. There are five large double bedrooms with the master featuring an en suite bathroom. The main living accommodation is set on the upper ground floor with the family kitchen and dining room the hub of the home.DescriptionDolcoath is a substantial family home set in a stunning location with astonishing countryside views arranged over three floors set in the highly sought after village of Pillaton. There are five large double bedrooms with the master featuring an en suite bathroom. The main living accommodation is set on the upper ground floor with the family kitchen and dining room the hub of the home. The generous living room is dual aspect with patio doors onto the veranda with views over Pillaton village. On the lower ground floor, you find the gym, games room, utility room and access to the integral garage. In addition to the sizable living accommodation, there are multiple stores and a workshop, plus a detached garage. In all this is a very spacious, well presented family home situated close to the amenities of Pillaton & only a short drive from St Mellion golf course & the A38 giving direct access to Plymouth & into the depths of Cornwall. The grand approach to this stunning substantial property is through stone pillars and electric gates. The flowing block paved driveway and parking for multiple vehicles, brings you to the main entrance and the detached garage and store rooms. To the side of the property, there is a graveled driveway to the rear garden and turning circle with access to the integral double garage.Main Front EntranceThe main entrance is accessed via a double glazed wood frame door with obscure glass and additional side panel which brings you into the internal reception lobby. This internal entrance lobby has a round feature window and gives you access via stairway to the lower level rooms .Via an internal glazed door, you have the main reception lobby giving you access to this levels living accommodationLiving Room 19' 6" x 17' 10" ( 5.94m x 5.44m )This is magnificent living room is duel aspects with a double glazed window with astonishing far reaching country side views plus patio doors which open out to the raise patio area. This also has astounding views that reach over to the village of Pillaton.. The room is bright with plenty of sunlight and has a feature stone built fire place with solid wood mantle and a slate hearth. This really is an exceptional living room.Second Bedroom 17' 10" x 10' 7" ( 5.44m x 3.23m )The second bedroom is a very great double bedroom with two large wardrobes with mirror sliding front doors and a built in dressing table. There is an additional cabinet above which also has a sliding mirror door. The window is wood framed double glazed window overlooking the rear of the property. RadiatorFamily Bathroom 7' 6" x 7' ( 2.29m x 2.13m )The family bathroom is a very good size room with bath, low level WC, pedestal hand wash basin, fully tiled and radiator. The window is obscured glass double glazed window overlooking the rear of the property.Shower RoomIn addition to the family bathroom you have a sizeable shower room which has a low level WC, pedestal hand wash basin, corner quadrant shower with main shower over. The room is fully tiled with a radiator and extractor fan. There is a wood framed obscure double glazed glass window overlooking the rear of the property.Third Bedroom 14' 7" x 11' 1" ( 4.45m x 3.38m )The third bedroom is a very good size double bedroom with radiator and two mirror fronted sliding door wardrobes with a built in dressing table between. There is also an additional mirrored glazed doors cabinet above. The window is a double glazed wood frame window overlooking the front of the property.Fourth Bedroom 13' 9" x 9' 7" ( 4.19m x 2.92m )The forth bedroom is an exceptional double with radiator and two built in door wardrobe. There is a double glazed wood framed window overlooking the side aspect of the property.Fifth Bedroom 10' 9" x 10' 8" ( 3.28m x 3.25m )The fifth bedroom is good size double with double fitted door wardrobe. It has double glazed wood frame windows with impressive country side views.Dining Room 11' 8" x 10' 8" ( 3.56m x 3.25m )This impressive Dining room has ample space for large family dining table, display unit and radiator. The room benefits from a very large double glazed wood frame window with exceptional views over the surrounding country side.Kitchen 15' 3" x 11' 7" ( 4.65m x 3.53m )The wonderful kitchen comprises of a selection of wall and base units with integrated dishwasher, double oven and electric four ring hob with extractor hood over. There is a one and a half bowl sink with mixer tap and a double glazed wood frame window overlooking the front of the property. This is a generous family kitchen and entertainment space.Cloakroom 7' 2" x 5' 6" ( 2.18m x 1.68m )The cloakroom has double glazed wood framed window overlooking the side of the property with far reaching country side views. There is a built in double concertina door wardrobe in addition to a large coat hanging rail with plenty of space for coats and shoes.Ground Floor WcThere is a low level WC with hand wash basin, radiator and tiled floor. There is obscure glazed double glazed wood frame window that overlook the side of the property.Study 9' 9" x 7' 9" ( 2.97m x 2.36m )The study has wall mounted shelving units and radiator. There is a double glazed wood frame window overlooking the side elevation of the property with stunning country side views and views of St Mellion golf course.Second Floor HallwayThe second floor hallway comprises of a Velux style window that give you views over the county side. There is storage cupboard which gives you access to the loft via a Narnia style door. From this landing you would lead into the stunning master bedroom and en-suite.Master Bedroom 20' 10" x 14' 3" ( 6.35m x 4.34m )The master bedroom is a very generous double with built in wardrobes and storage along one wall which incorporates a large dressing table. There are also two additional built in wardrobes and a radiator. There is a double glazed wood frame window overlooking the side of the property which gives you far reaching views over the village of Pillaton. This room then leads into its own en-suite bathroom.En-Suite  7' 4" x 6' 8" ( 2.24m x 2.03m )This en-suite comprises of a low level WC, bidet, bath and vanity hand wash unit with extractor fan.Private Gym 19' 8" x 13' 6" ( 5.99m x 4.11m )This room is a large room with access to the wonderful rear garden with double glazed wood frame door. The room has two double glazed wood framed windows also overlooking the rear garden. This room is currently set up as a gym and leads into the games room.Games Room 16' 1" x 13' 6" ( 4.90m x 4.11m )The games room has a wood frame half double glazed door access to the rear garden. There is a wood framed double glazed window that looks over the rear garden and the astonishing far reaching country side views. There is a radiator and access into the large utility room. From the games room you also have internal access to the large double integral garage.Utility Room 13' 6" x 9' 9" ( 4.11m x 2.97m )This is ample utility room has a selection of base units, radiator and plumbing for a washing machine. There is also plenty of space for a tumble dryer and a chest fridge freezer. There is a double glazed window overlooking the rear garden.Internal GarageThere is a double internal garage with an electric up and over double door. The garage houses the oil fired boiler. There is plenty of space for two cars and additional storage. There are also two large built in storage cupboards.Detached Garage 25' 5" x 18' ( 7.75m x 5.49m )The single up and over electric door garage is of double sized internally with plenty of space for vehicles and a workshop area. There is ample space for a workshop area and storage. The garage has four obscure glass windows.GardenThe front garden is mainly laid to lawn with a raised patio area with a Cornish hedge front boundary.At the side of the property there is a raised patio area which takes advantage of the gorgeous country side views and over Pillaton Village. The substantial rear garden is mainly laid to lawn with mature shrubs and trees and back directly onto fields There is a beautiful wooden summer house taking advantage of the unbelievable views out over the valley and onto the moors. Coming around the property you have a block built path that will then bring you again to the detached garage. The oil tank is housed in the front garden and is concealed. Outside water tap.Storeage Sheds And WorkshopsIn addition the detached Garage, there are also two storage sheds and lean-to ideal for garden equipment and larger machinery. listing.description: An outstanding waterside residence with beach frontage, situated on a impressive plot of around a third of an acre, with breathtaking views over the Bay and Coastline to Rame Head and over to Looe Island. An exceptional location that does not come around that often.Downderry is a small coastal village located on the South East Cornwall coast within a designated area of outstanding natural beauty, with excellent beaches and clean waters for surfers and swimmers alike. The village is well equipped with a local village store, restaurants, public houses, doctors and village school. The nearby town of Looe is approx 5 miles away and has excellent leisure facilities including a local sailing, tennis and golf club, with the addition of an interesting working harbour and fishing. The city of Plymouth is about 12 miles on the main A38 with the new Drake Circus shopping mail and an abundance of restaurants and bars and the waterfront on the Barbican and Hoe, with marinas and cross channel sailings to France.Accommodation - Yardley House is a large detached four bedroom property, constructed in the mid 1920’s and has been in the same ownership for the past 60 years. With the addition of a detached one bedroom annexe located above the double garage, has up until recently, been used as a holiday let. The property sits in a private, yet commanding position just off the Main Road through Downderry and has uninterrupted Sea and Coastline views with direct beach frontage.Accommodation comprises of an entrance hall, kitchen, breakfast room, dining room and reception room on the ground floor and 4 bedrooms and bathroom on the first floor. The addition of the balcony on the first floor overlooking the garden and out to sea.The detached annexe is located over the double garage and is approached via concrete steps. Accommodation comprises of large reception room with sliding doors leading to the kitchen. Double bedroom with ensuite bathroom. Garden and sea views are enjoyed from the veranda.Gardens & Grounds - The property is approached off the B3247 Main Road through Downderry. The grounds surrounding the property include a large driveway/hard standing including turning area to the front with parking for numerous vehicles and access to the double garage, bordered by mature trees and hedgerow. The rear is mainly laid to lawn bordered by hedgerow, mature trees, bushes and stone walling with direct beach frontage with uninterrupted views of the sea, coastline to Rame Head and across to Looe Island.Condition and Potential - The property is in need of refurbishment and updating. A similar size plot has recently been completely re-developed and now consists of four large detached four Bedroomed properties. Subject to planning, this could be possible on this site.FreeholdCouncil Tax Band - Band - D Annexe - A

The property benefits from a large, secluded plot with spectacular countryside views and modern, open plan living accommodation. Built with traditional timber frame methods combined with modern materials, the property maintains many period character features but with the convenience of modern technology and efficiencies. The village of Henham provides good amenities including the village jmi School which has an excellent reputation. There is also a public house, active local church and community groups. There is easy access to the larger village of Elsenham with a village store, public houses, schooling and railway station with direct links to London Liverpool Street and Cambridge. Stansted Airport with fast train services and the M11 (J8) is approximately 10 minutes by car. The market town of Bishops Stortford is 9 miles to the south  The open plan kitchen offers flexible living accommodation with the modern conveniences of a range cooker with 6 ring gas hob, wine cooler, American style fridge/freezer, built in microwave, dishwasher and double butler sink. listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: A well presented detached family home offering spacious and versatile accommodation of about 2829 sq ft, situated in a prestigious and private close, within easy reach of Warlingham Green.   The accommodation on the ground floor comprises of a spacious reception hall, sitting room with feature brick fireplace and sliding doors opening on to the garden, separate dining room, study, cloakroom and bedroom with ensuite shower room. The kitchen/breakfast room is a particular feature of the property. It is a generous size with a feature brick wall, sliding doors giving access to the side and sky light allowing for maximum light penetration. There are a good range of wall and base wooden fronted cabinets and granite works tops. Integrated appliances include a Stoves oven with 7 ring gas hob and extractor, fridge/freezer and dishwasher. A double garage can be accessed from the separate utility room that has plumbing for additional appliances. The upstairs accommodation is also of good proportions and include a master bedroom suite with fitted wardrobes and ensuite bathroom, three further bedrooms a family bathroom and galleried landing.SituationHuntsmans Close is a private and prestigious development off Homefield Road within easy reach of Warlingham Green with its range of local shops, restaurants and pubs and Sainsburys supermarket is a short distance away. The beautiful North Downs are close at hand providing the opportunity for pleasant walks. Nearby Upper Warlingham railway station (in zone 6) provides services to London Bridge and Victoria in approximately 35 minutes. The M25 motorway is about 4 miles away at junction 6. There are schools in both the state and private sectors, golf courses and riding schools nearby.OutsideTo the front of the property there is driveway providing off-street parking which leads to a double garage. The garage usefully has direct internal access to the house. The front garden is laid to lawn with flower beds and hedgerow. The rear garden enjoys a high degree of seclusion and is enclosed by evergreen trees, hedgerow and timber fencing. It is a wide level garden with a patio, lawn and mature flower borders.Entrance Hall Cloakroom Kitchen Dining Room Utility Room Sitting Room Dining Room Study Master Bedroom Bathroom Ensuite Shower Room Garage
listing.short_description: A well presented detached family home offering spacious and versatile accommodation of about 2788 sqft, situated in a prestigious and private close, within easy reach of Warlingham Green.
